Generator.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   Generator.h
00006 
00007   Two Abstract classes, Generator, and BlockGenerator, that effects which
00008   generate audio should derive from.  
00009   
00010   Block Generator breaks the synthesis task up into smaller parts.
00011 
00012   Dominic Mazzoni
00013   Vaughan Johnson
00014 
00015 **********************************************************************/
00016 
00017 
00018 #ifndef __AUDACITY_GENERATOR__
00019 #define __AUDACITY_GENERATOR__
00020 
00021 #include "Effect.h"
00022 
00023 // Base class for Generators (effects which fill a given duration)
00024 class Generator : public Effect
00025 {
00026 public:
00027    Generator() : mDuration(sDefaultGenerateLen) { }
00028 
00029 protected:
00030    // Amount of time to generate, in seconds
00031    double mDuration;
00032 
00033    // [ GenerateTrack() must be overridden by the actual generator class ]
00034    // Precondition:  mDuration > 0.0
00035    // Postcondition: <tmp> is filled with the data intended for <track>
00036    virtual bool GenerateTrack(WaveTrack *tmp,
00037                               const WaveTrack &track,
00038                               int ntrack) = 0;
00039 
00040    virtual bool Init() { return true; }
00041 
00042    // Actions to perform at the respective points in the generation process
00043    virtual void BeforeGenerate() { };
00044    virtual void BeforeTrack(const WaveTrack &track) { };
00045 
00046    // Actions to perform upon respective outcomes
00047    // (For example, Success might save the parameters that were used.)
00048    virtual void Success() { };
00049    virtual void Failure() { };
00050 
00051    // Precondition:
00052    // mDuration is set to the amount of time to generate in seconds
00053    // Postcondition:
00054    // If mDuration was valid (>= 0), then the tracks are replaced by the
00055    // generated results and true is returned. Otherwise, return false.
00056    bool Process();
00057 };
00058 
00059 // Abstract generator which creates the sound in discrete blocks, whilst
00060 // showing a progress bar
00061 class BlockGenerator : public Generator {
00062 public:
00063    BlockGenerator() { }
00064 protected:
00065    // Number of samples to generate
00066    sampleCount numSamples;
00067 
00068    // Postcondition: data[0..block) filled with generated samples
00069    virtual void GenerateBlock(float *data,
00070                               const WaveTrack &track,
00071                               sampleCount block) = 0;
00072 
00073    // Generate the track, one block at a time, & adding the results to tmp
00074    bool GenerateTrack(WaveTrack *tmp, const WaveTrack &track, int ntrack);
00075 };
00076 
00077 #endif
